description:
First time I have ever had or picked up a Papa John's pie. We ordered the extra large with Canadian bacon and sausage. I walked a few minutes to picked up the preordered very hot pie and called Uber to drive me back to the hotel; for a total elapsed time of 20 minutes from the initial call.

The undercarriage was nicely browned and the crust was surprisingly very good.The cheese pulled somewhat and the toppings were very good. The sauce was sweeter than I would have liked but it does provide an interesting ingredient for a fun to eat pizza. $10.95 special, ten slices. Papa John's is the third largest take out pizza chain, and their pizza is better tasting than many restaurants' pizza.

Here's the ingredient list:
https://www.papajohns.com/company/papa-johns-ingredients.html
author: Jerry P.

description: Is that pizza place ?? On cheese only tomato  sauce and little bit cheese ??? On chicken BBQ pizza lots of BBQ sauce.. hard to find where is chicken .... only the nesty pizza ever we had .....
author: Bikram T.

description:
Let me start by saying I love papa Jones pizza 
unfortunately the food I asked for wasn't all right 
The driver was great but after looking at the order 
Closely I noticed that there was no sauce with my wings or any garlic sauce with the bread I ordered 
So I called back to the store the manager only to find out that You don't get any sauce with any orders after a few minutes of George Gonzalez telling me that he could have his driver return with the sauce I was told by the driver that it would be an extra 3 dollars on top of my $30 dollar order with out a receipt for the sauces nice way
To treat a new customer
author: Bobby V.

description: Ordered delivery here through door dash, both my wife and I immediately started feeling terrible, and I basically vomited all this pizza up all night long, and my wife started vomiting in the morning. Called them just to let them know, in case there's some bigger issue, and all the guy said was, "oh you have to talk to door dash about it". I'm never trusting any Papa John's again.
author: thien t.

description: Papa John and the terrible, horrible, no good, very bad service. All cash registers weren't working (you couldn't pay with cash), and it took them 10 minutes to get the computer started. I ordered just one pizza and it took over 30 minutes to make. Very ghetto and low-class joint. I just wanted a quick bite to eat, but will never go back. Shady people all around. Got harassed by some Spanish foreign customer inside and had to call the cops on them. The pizza was decent. All around 0/5 stars.
author: Jason L.

description: The only thing that is good there would be the pizza sauces, which obviously they don't make it at the their restaurant. This location got 2.5 stars. This place needs a makeover. Makeover for new crew members and management.
author: Mario L.

description:
I wouldn't recommend ordering even if it was free they charged me for food I never received and argued for hours to refund me my money
Horrible customer service manger Definitely needs to be fired
author: Ivan L.

description:
I had a great pizza experience from this PJ because i ordered online for CarryOut and 2:00pm for pick up.  The status said they were boxing the pizza right as i was parking.  I ran in and got the pizza and drove home, sat down at the table and the pizza was hot.  The guys inside were friendly and really working hard.  When you order with extra sauce, that's what you get.  They give you lots of sauce and that's what I like!  i ordered a large cheese with mushroom, and it was very good. Pizza exactly what you expect from a national chain joint.  
Your experience will be different if you order on the weekends and nights during dinner rush crunch time.  Their few drivers are overloaded, what do you expect?  Don't risk it, just CarryOut if you can.
author: hugh L.

description: Not customer friendly and food prepared sloppy. Man working there very rude over phone when ordering. Pizza was undercooked
author: Tifani F.

description:
So, I just received delivery of a pizza and the pizza was slid all over the box. I called your "store" and whoever answered the phone said that "they don't do that" after I had to explain to him 6 times about the "little plastic table" that OTHER PIZZA RESTAURANTS USE TO KEEP THE PIZZA FROM SLIDING AROUND IN THE BOX (Pizza Hut, anyone?). Now, since I've done research and know that the stabilizer isn't for keeping the pizza from sliding around in the box. Why, when I led in with the pizza is dismembered all over the box, first apologize and ask me what they can do about it?

I've never had a pizza come apart and slide to one side of the box before. Never.

I chose this over Pizza Hut to give you a chance, my mistake that I won't be repeating.
author: Adrian J.

description: Don't eat here! Pizza made me extremely sick! Ordered mushroom and pepperoni with garlic sauce. Ended up at the doctors. Don't let this big chain poison you, seriously felt horrible!
author: Bauble C.

description: Ordered online delivery from this location a couple times. Haven't had any complaints about service or pizza quality. Can't go wrong with Papa John's.
author: John Q.

description:
One star for today 7/16/17 for poor customer service on the part on management. 
7/16/17 6:42pm I called with the same special request I always do: NO GARLIC CUPS with pizza; PIZZA SAUCE CUPS ONLY!!! The young lady who answered the phone assured me it'd be taken care of. I received the order WITH GARLIC CUPS!!! 
I called the store and got put on hold then the line went dead after 5 minutes or so. I called back and the young man put me on hold again after I demanded to speak to the manager.......... After another angry 5 minutes of being on hold, I hung up. I tried calling back only to repeatedly get a busy signal. 
I never got this sloppy irresponsible excuse for customer service whenever John has been on shift as manager. Whoever is on shift right now needs to be trained to handle their customers more like we actually matter instead of asking us to "hold" and then blowing us off. I guess since I don't seem to matter after being a loyal customer since before the Sutter location opened, I should start ordering from Dominos and Pizza Hut. Thank the so-called manager on shift for helping me see that I don't matter as a paying customer.  I'd advise you to pass this up to the top of your chain of command; that is unless none of your other customers matter either.
author: Damon W.

description: When you order papa john's you know what you are getting, but food aside, the customer service there was great! I ordered takeout and everyone who helped me was so nice, double checked my order and made sure I was happy.
author: Connie W.

description: I always have ordered online. I like the tracking system so I can see where they are in the process of making and delivering the pizza. The pizza has always been good and delivery generally close to the time they say. A couple times it was somewhat later enough for me to call and check but not to cancel.  Pizza has always been good and what I expected.
author: Kim B.

description: My wife is  currently running to the toilet for the fifth time throwing up from pizza she ate today at lunch. AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COSTS!
author: Brittney L.

description: Man this is like the mediocre PJ they have in Europe. They are always lazy with the toppings!
author: Sophie P.

description: Really enjoyed being lied to by the manager on duty at this Papa John's location for over 30 minutes, an hour after we ordered online. "Your order will be ready in 7 minutes" turned into over 30 minutes by the time we gave up and left tonight. We were there for over an hour and they cancelled more orders than they fulfilled in that time... which was interesting considering how many people were working. Walked across the street and picked up another pizza in under 3 minutes.
author: Jesse G.

description: I've ordered carry out from here upwards of five times over the course of several months, so I feel that I can give an accurate review of this place. It's perfect for some cheap, tasty, quick pizza. Obviously it's not comparable to somewhere in the city like Tony's, but it's not trying to be. There are always coupons and I can get a large pizza for under $15. They've always been on-time with making it and my pizzas have always looked and tasted great. The staff has been nothing but polite, energetic and friendly, even when I'm picking up a pizza close to closing or they are very hectic. All in all consistently meets and exceeds my expectations for a place that is meant to be fast, cheap and delicious!
author: Sarah S.

description: Customer service is terrible. Manager Mo heard of my complaints. Ordered my pizzas 2 hours ahead. They were not even placed in the system . Had to wait for another 45 minutes to receive them. Manager ordered me for proof. I showed him my call log. And he continuously asked me how did this happen. As a customer I do not appreciate being questioned nor making me sound dumb. The female Latina employee in the front cashier was also not respectful. Disappointed in their customer service. It's ashamed how a business will not run be sufficient for customer satisfaction.
author: Chrishel D.

description: Quality was subpar. Service was slow and incorrect order. And it's not cheap. So no reason to come back.
author: Miguel L.

description: This pizza is revolutionary. At first, I doubted it, but after taking a few bites of that steaming hot goodness, my mindset was completely changed. My eyes were opened, and my life was cleansed. I walked into the establishment and was greeted by the god himself, Papa John. He told me that he was going to be stepping down from his position as CEO  of Papa Johns pizza. I cried and told him multiple times not to, but he insisted. Steve Richie stepped into the building. John stared at him menacingly. John quickly grabbed a container of parmesan and sprinkled it in Steven eyeballs. Steve screamed as me and Papa ran to the back of the kitchen where we stole ALL of the pizza. We jumped into the getaway car and drove to the nearest bank. I walked up to the bank manager. "I would like to trade this pizza for $500,000." I said. The manager agreed, and handed me the money. He asked for the pizza, but I bounced. John was waiting in the car, and I hopped in the back. The bank called the police. A couple minutes in driving, we had the cops on our tail. We drove faster and faster, until our car hit the limit. The engine was over heated, and was going to explode. I looked into Papa John's eyes and whispered into his ear... "Better ingredients, Better pizza." The car exploded and I saw John fly miles into the sky. I jumped out of the burning vehicle onto the road. I am currently writing this review in the hospital, I had broken both my legs from the incident. This is probably my last message, but I have one last thing to say... Papa's in the House.
author: Noah C.

description: Worst delivery service. First time around we never received our pizza because they were over two hours late. The owner apologized which I understood. Then I received an email for a complimentary pizza so we take advantage and add the promo code in and they show up (30 minutes late) requesting money. The delivery guy calls the manager and the manager knows nothing. Update your system. Absolute WORSE service I've ever had.
author: Lindsay S.

description:
Ordered online and chose carry-out. Ready as expected (well done, square cut), 15-25 minutes after I placed my order. Only downside was no accessible parking (I double parked) and it would have been nice to be acknowledged when I walked in the store. I wasn't greeted by the store employee on duty until the customer in front of me asked if I wanted to go ahead since she was still deciding.

Also I liked that the employee walked around the counter, opened the box and made sure I approved of the pizza before I took it.
author: Joran R.

description:
I first came in not sure of what I wanted and this guy William helped me saying it was better to order online if I wanted a 5 topping pizza. I did just that and online it wouldn't let me take off the beef and I tried to tell him and he assisted me and accommodated me to what I wanted. Very great personal and customer service skills. 

This was my first time eating here and William made my experience great. My food was ready in a timely fashion and I must say my pizza is good!! I'll come here as long as he's here. Thanks
author: Chanel D.

description:
Papa John's has become a place we order from when we are looking for comfort pizza (I made that up, but it makes sense!).
Its a place we can be assured of 1. Quality 2. Quick Delivery 3. Sufficient Quantity (for 2 people).
We have been ordering here for over 4-5 months but I dont know why I missed writing a review. I usually forget if I call for food home, maybe that's why. But this place needs this review for sure.
One more thing I really like about them is that they are true to whatever offers they advertise- cost wise (TV, pamphlets, etc) unlike some other famous pizza chains that we have been highly unhappy about. 
Over all, I am a happy repeat customer!
author: Shruti D.

description: This is a HORRIBLE location the manager is very RUDE !!! First off the employee tried to accuse me of stealing then when I showed the manager my bag with no hesitation he still tried to say I stole AFTER I PURCHASED pizza & chicken . The MANAGER PUT HIS HANDS ON ME, MAN HANDLED ME AND TRIED TO FORCE ME TO STAY INSIDE THE STORE the sad part is I was cooperating and had my two younger kids with me
author: Kieanas L.

description: Who doesn't love Papa Johns?! First time ordering from this location (which delivers) and I am pleased. The only reason that this location didn't get 5 stars is because a) the credit card machine didn't work and I had to walk to an ATM and b) the first associate I spoke with did not understand the specials that are being offered online. The food was delivered hot and fresh! Pizza was good...
author: Rhett B.

description: Add sauce to Uber eats menu. Ranch is a a requirement for pizza. Once you add sauce section to Uber eats then I will change to 5 stars
author: Bryce T.

description: We ordered through eat 24 & ended up with one wrong pizza, called the store they couldn't help us & we ended up getting a refund for the one pizza, this place is as nasty as Pizza Hut or dominos, customer service not helpful said the only way they could correct the problem was for us to order another pizza but they would have to charge us for it
author: Chaparral A.

description: Every time I order from uber eats, they never put on the toppings I ordered. Customer service here is extremely bad, I asked the manager to speak to his boss and he hung up on me twice.
author: Devin A.

description:
Very disappointed, two and a half hours later and the pizza still isn't here and no one will actually answer the phone. If you want to destroy your reputation this is the way to do so. And we are just two blocks down the street!

Btw, this is my first yelp review, thank you for sucking so bad!
author: Brian K.

description: They don't deliver to a place that's only a mile away from them so don't bother if you're farther than that. Also, the referral code they give you doesn't even work. They're just a lame pizza place to order from over all.
author: Malani M.

description: Iv ordered delivery from this location twice and service usually is great. Today I ordered a pizza and realized it had an insect on it. I immediately threw the slice out and called the restaurant. I was told I could not be refunded even though there was a insect on the pizza. I was asked if I'd like a new pizza but I did not want once as I don't trust the cleanliness of this location. Very disappointed
author: Hemali M.

description: I come to San Francisco every 6 months for a Dr appointment at UCSF Multiple Sclerosis center.  We always stay a night or 2.  This time we descided to have a pizza delivered and eat it in our motel room then go out. This pizza was nasty, cold, bitter taste and the sauce tasted old.  Never again will we order from papa johns in San Francisco
author: Tabytha Q.

description: I ordered a pizza, got email conformation. Papa John's gave to the Trump clan(Uber eats). Never showed up. Had to call and make new pizza, another 40 minutes. Never again order from Papa johns. Don't look out for long term customers in sf. # boycott sf Papa johns.
author: Joshua H.

description: I placed an order for delivery via a UberEATS and called to check the status after it was delayed. The employee who answered the phone was very rude and refused to check the status of the order. Will not order again.
author: Travis G.

description: Classic Papa John's pizza -- we picked bbq sauce for the base was a little too saucy but I will be more specific next time. Overall it was great, the garlic dipping sauce is a must have.
author: Peter W.

description: Never delivered pizza - claimed they did - then they said it was in front of them.   I called 4 times they said it was on their way.  They won't refund my full value either.  Do not order from here.
author: Neel P.

description:
I was walking by and noticed a Papa John's Pizza on Sutter.  Since I've never had Papa John's, and I'm a Peyton Manning fan, I thought I'd stop in to find if they delivered to my place.  The manager couldn't have been nicer, and when he found out I was just stopping in to see if I was in their delivery zone and hadn't tried Papa John's he offered me a slice for free.  

That was really appreciated, and I took him up on his offer.  Unfortunately, the pizza was terrible. The sauce had no flavor, it was insipid.  As bad a slice of pizza as I've ever had in my life, maybe the worst.  Peyton, I don't know what passes for taste buds in Colorado, but for the love of god, please tell John Schnatter (the CEO) to step up his game.  

I've lived in NYC, upstate NY, Virginia, San Francisco, LA, and even Connecticut.  That slice finished in last place, and by a comfortable margin.  John, you should appreciate your good worker, since he certainly represented your company well, but I'm sorry to say the pizza fell flat....actually worse than flat.
author: August I.

description:
My friend, who is not only a very large proponent but also very heavily invested in Papa John's Pizza, threw a Super Bowl party and showcased his commitment to the firm by ordering a few pizza pies from this location in San Francisco. 

It was a fitting meal for the Super Bowl given that Papa John's is the current "Official Pizza of the National Football League" per the terms of their multi-year sponsorship agreement.  

From what I saw (and tasted), my friend ordered a thin crust "The Meats", a regular "The Works", and Cheesesticks.  Pretending that I was burning as many calories watching football as those who were playing were, I tried multiple slices of all the aforementioned varieties - both with and without the oily garlic sauce that came on the side.

The result was that I was just "whelmed" by this pizza experience  - neither under or over.  As such, 3 stars feels like the appropriate rating here.

Hopefully, I'm still invited to my friend's next Super Bowl party.
author: Sebastian N.

description:
Very poor customer service.  I called in to confirm that they recieved an online order and the person who I spoke to was very rude and unprofessional.

I always call to confirm orders because I've had bad experiences with restaurants receiving them Papa Johns in particular. I may have ordered online but I'm still a Papa Johns customer and I don't appreciate being treated like I've done something wrong asking if you got my order.
author: Ammon D.

description: Quick and easy place to stop by if you want to grab a pizza on the go.  Late night seems to get a bit busier than  day time so give them a little extra time. Always hot, and good. Not a sit down place. There is always so much going on in the neighborhood you always be entertained.
author: J J.

description:
After waiting more than a year to see what would replace La Mexicana, I was disappointed when Papa John's moved in with their lousy politics and $3.39 delivery fee (none of which goes to the driver).

But politics will never come between me and pizza, so I ordered delivery on a Friday night during game 3 of the World Series. In the interest of objectivity I selected "Papa's Favorite" (pepperoni and sausage). To make sure it was a fair evaluation, I got an order of buffalo wings and an 8" mega chocolate chip cookie. And I added 3 garlic butter sauces to my order, for science.

My order was submitted at 6:59 and was delivered at 7:18. Granted, I live just a few blocks away (I'm not lazy; I was controlling the variables!), but that is still freaking impressive. The driver used our tricky call box correctly, rather than phoning me to be let in, passing my litmus test for delivery.

The pizza surpassed my expectations. It is definitely among the better chain pizzas. I liked the sauce and appreciated the generous amount of cheese. The crust was on the soft side and buckled under the weighty toppings, but wasn't soggy. However the sausage was only a grade above "rabbit poo pellets." The wings were incredibly soggy, typical of pizza places without deep fryers, but they were also large and tasty. I can see the mega cookie being a hit with groups, as it really helps stretch the pizza. 

You MUST order online via the special offers page. I paid $14 for my large (usually $19.99) and got $1 off on the cookie. The wings were regular price- 8 for $7. I was initially upset about the $3.39 delivery fee, but it ended up being a better value than many other pizza places in the area. Just make sure that you still tip your driver what you usually would!!
author: Lauren C.

description: Delivery is bad. An hour late (and still no pizza). Weak sauce. Accurate delivery predictions are dependent on sobriety of person answering the phone. More stoned == slower delivery, and lesser-accurate prediction. Only get delivery if you're okay waiting up to two hours.
author: Clark C.

description:
Solid franchise spot. I wasn't feeling too well while attending a conference at the Marriott nearby and decided to order a pizza online from here instead of going out. My order arrived in under 40 minutes to my hotel room during rush hour and the pizza was hot and to my liking.

Thanks guys!
author: Brian C.

description:
Can't complain about the pizzas, although they vary slightly depending on the server, it's always good and satisfying. 

Fast services, pizzas can be ready in 15 if you're picking up.
author: Hua W.

description: I find myself ordering from papa johns nearly once a week and the pizza is always superb for the price.  Generally arrives on time, cooked correctly, with the secret butter sauce.  I tried the pan pizza and it was very breads- not the fault of this location
author: Kyle D.

description:
I just ordered pizza, breadsticks, boneless wings, soda and tons of dips and WOW it was super fast, FRESH & HOT and the driver was beyond amazing and friendly...you usually get rude delivery people, but NOPE, so awesome. 

And, then I called to give the store kudos and the manager, Johnny, actually took time to speak with me and get my true feedback, on a Saturday evening no less...I'm blown away by the food and service from this Papa John's. I will only be ordering pizza, wings and breadsticks from here, YUM!

Seriously, this store has surpassed ALL of my expectations and I will be blasting their stellar service on all other social media websites so others can enjoy this amazing store/food/people. Keep up the wonderful job Johnny and all, you guys ROCKK!!!
author: Michael H.

description:
Good price and tasty pizza!! My friend wanna get free icecream so we ordered by used the spacial offer with promo code via online order and asked for carry out. We got 2 large with free icecream for only $19.99!!! The meat and the works are fantastic! We dont like gree pepper on the works so we changed to the roasted garlic and it super good combination with it!
I will give 5 stars for your tasty pizza but the reason that I gave you 4 stars is because the onlion system. I ordered hia the website and when I finished my order the website said will send me the reciept and the time when the pizza finish to my e-mail. I waited almost 15 mins and nothing send to me so I called to the store which I ordered to pick up and a guy said "your order are ready for pick up!".  So... please fix your online system and next time I will give you full starts!

ps. I still waiting for my online reciept :P where is it?
author: Orange S.

description:
It is chain pizza place so I am giving it 5 stars understanding that. Is it as good as Tony's or Capo's? No- but it does not need to be. Delivery was fast under 40 minutes, 
I got the Buffalo chicken pizza and really enjoyed it (minus the onions). The garlic knots were drowned in delicious garlic butter. The little chicken poppers were tasty and I think both sides at 5.00 was a great price. Completely happy. make sure to check out the special offers tab for good deals.
author: Susan M.

description: Every time I order pizza is delayed and delivered lukewarm or cold. They have a major distribution/delivery problem
author: Libby C.

description:
My new favorite pizza chain on the block. I didn't even know they were open (I just never seem to cross Sutter/Hyde much anymore) just discovered them on Eat 24, and man they hooked it up! 

Good price, fast service, +1 star for Eat24 which means you can buy this pizza with paypal (Repeat: if you order with Eat24, you can buy Papa John's pizza with paypal) and the night crew were good guys (If the manager reads this, I really liked my service!)

Glad to see that there is alternative to Dominos, and the crappy Arab pizza establishments save Mustafios.
author: Stevie D.

description: Love this location. The management is very friendly and personable, I feel apart of their family walking in. Wish I could give more than 5 stars honestly. I have nothing bad to say about this location they have provided excellent service.
author: Jordan L.

description:
The first time I ordered from Papa John's, 5 years ago, I was served plastic strings in my sandwich. This time I tried ordering for pick up, I got a yawny Papa John's employee on the phone, speaking like it takes so much effort to open her mouth, basically providing a terrible service - and it was just taking order on the phone! If you're that sloppy with answering the phone, how sloppy would you be handling my food?? 

Papa John's, how are you such a shity company?
author: Bee S.

description:
How this place is still in business is beyond me. 3 hours for pizza and I ended up canceling. They somehow didn't write down my phone number correctly. Instead of an apology, they hang up the phone. 3 hours and 20 mins later I get a text saying they are the front door. 

Just don't bother to order from here cause you will end up getting your own food anyway.
author: Adam R.

description:
Was advised that wait time on delivery order was 1.5 hours.  Not great on a Friday night.  Called two hours after the order and was told that they never got our order... Looking at the other reviews, this is a very common occurrence. 

Papa John's is my favorite chain pizza. But this franchise is absolute crap. Don't bother.
author: Melissa N.

description:
It's a Papa Johns, not much above and beyond any other Papa Johns in any other city.

That being said, compared to the Dominos and Pizza Hut down the street, it's easily the better of the three. Compared to Patxi's though, it falls short. But that's on another level...
author: Kacey C.

description:
You are going to feel guilty ordering it. You will feel guilty walking there or waiting to get it delivered. You will feel the most guilty when you are holding two boxes of pizzas, cheesesticks, and soda. But that moment that that cheese and processed meat hits your mouth with some garlic butter sauce, you won't give a fuck. 

That's Papa Johns in a nutshell. Its like watching your favorite show after its gone off the rails in season 6. You know its not good anymore but dammit do you feel good watching those familiar characters again. Then 5 hours later you feel terrible. You know what this place is. Good pizza, not so great prices but fantastic options and garlic sauce! Its not as complex as Round Table but better and fresher feeling than Dominos and Pizza Hut. I mean its the only one I would write a review about. 

Plus its now downtown and I don't have to wait 45 minutes for an order. There is no reason you should be reading this review unless you are from another country where they don't have these. Its like reading a review for Mcdonalds. Its the same shit. 

The staff is new and bungling but they will get it right eventually. Have fun eat a greasy cheesy pizza and feel fat for three days. Its the American way.
author: Nick R.

description:
Good food. Made fresh and fast. Very clean and friendly staff. 
They are very reasonable with prices and product quality is better than dominos and pizza hut. 
Chocolate chip cookie is to die for.
They always offer specials in beginning of call which I think is great. 
This place rocks.
author: Jay S D.

description: People always want to jump on the "no franchise bandwagon" but y'all are just crazy. Taste their damn pizza and that's all you need to know. Look at the bottom of your pizza box after you're done and see the little amount of grease, serious. Yes it sometimes takes a while, but this damn store is on one of the busiest streets with no parking! Been eating it for years and won't stop, thanks for being here in SF!!
author: Raven N.

description: I'm done with papa john's! There's always something wrong with our order. We order there often but the service is bad. It's never ready when we pick it up, we always have to wait another 5 mins. I had really PAINFUL stomach pain after eating their pizza. They must've put something in it that made me sick. If you're a frequent customer and you made previous complaints, they will remember you. If you order again, they'll probably put something in your pizza just to get payback. I don't trust them anymore. So if I were you, don't order here. There are other good pizza places around the city.
author: Isaiah V.

description:
Ready for some cursing text messages on your cell after you order from here! Get ready peeps! 

I've been a true and devoted Papa Johns pizza fan for 13 years now. And recently, when I ordered from this location, here's what I got:
1) order arrived incomplete
2) called the store after to inform them of (1), and they said they wouldn't refund but credit me the cost of the missed item only. I mentioned I was no longer in the area where I ordered from( hence redelivery won't work), have been calling their phone for an hour and couldn't get thru. Oh n the manager was too busy to talk to me, so he asked to call me back. I gladly agreed. 
3) manager never called back. They still attempted redelivering and harassing my friends to accept delivery, even when I told them I was no longer around. 
4) and worst of all- upon declining delivery- I get a text message on my cell phone within seconds saying- "U petty Bitch!" Way to go with Customer Satisfaction!
5) it's been over a week. Manager never called back! No refunds issued! 

Worst pizza experience EVER! How rude to send ur customer curse texts? Is this what I share my phone number with them for? Not sure who else they'd share my information with! NEVER EVER ORDERING FROM HERE AGAIN! 

I tried Pizza Hut recently. Not bad.. Sweet new toppings, AND THEY TREAT ME WITH RESPECT TOO!
author: Pinky A.

description:
I wanted to say thanks to James for his service! I had telling my fiancé for the longest that I love papa johns. He never had it, until we ran upon it. 

We walked in and James greets us, "Papa John's is the 2nd best pizza!" We laughed, but he went to explaining how serious he was. 
After a brief but detailed explanation, he waited a WHILE for us to make a choice about what we wanted, (we're fine at sharing, but we're indecisive). He was very patient, even went to helping us out and recommending exactly what we had a taste for. 
After we made a confident order, he gave us all the info I wanted to make the review for him. He added the girl who made our pizza AND COOKIE PIZZA, (if you've never had it, try it), but I cannot remember her name right now!

I just want to say thanks guys the service and food was great. He went back in to get some napkins, only to tell James that the pizza didn't survive past the parking space! Haha!
author: Mani A.

description: Bad experience. Driver made me come out to him to get my pizza. I ordered (and paid for) extra sauces. I didn't see them, so I asked the driver where they were and he said they were in the pizza box. But when I got back inside and opened the box, they weren't there. We also ordered Anchovies on the side and only received 3 small pieces - enough for one slice. I called the store and they said they couldn't issue a refund, but to call next time and tell them what happened and they would throw in an extra sauce. Really?
author: Daron J.

description:
Well, After always seeing the tv commercials, I was excited to see this spot open up not too far from where I live, so I excitedly placed a large order the next day to sample the wares.

When the pizza's arrived, very quickly, I was pleasantly surprised.

When i opened the pizza boxes. not so much.

My issue? Toppings. if I pay for them I want them.  One of the pizza's i ordered was described as "A veggie lover's delight! Our Garden Fresh pizza is generously topped with fresh-sliced onions & green peppers, gourmet baby portabella mushrooms, ripe black olives and juicy, fresh-sliced Roma tomatoes.".

By no definition were my toppings generous. They didn't even cover the whole slice.  Their was a very small section near the middle of each slice, (around the whole pie)that had ANY toppings on it. I'm talking not enough toppings to throw over a handful of chips and call it nachos.  Like literally two table spoons of all of the above vegetables combined sprinkled in a slim trail on my giant Xlarge Pizza. Also barely any sauce.

I got Garlic instead of olives. somehow there was (No Exxageration) a minimum of between 4-6 garlic cloves, PER SLICE.  Would have loved to have see the Bell Peppers, Mushrooms, single onion slice or teaspoon of diced (not sliced) tomatoes given this type of attention.

I literally put sauce on top of their slices, added fresh chopped vegetables, spices, and cheese and baked it in the oven for 10-12 minutes to make it decent.

AVOID. Village Pizza on Van Ness crushes this inferior entry to our pizza scene.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Horrible customer service from this location.

I placed an order at 7pm through Eat24 with a 60 minute estimated delivery (so 8pm eta).  After my pizza was taking nearly 2 hours to get to me I had called the location about the status.  The first person I spoke to said it had gone out for delivery at 7:30, it was now 8:30 so it wasn't making sense.  I was put on hold to speak to a manager but during that time I got a text from the driver saying he was downstairs.  I went and no one was there.  

I called back and got the manager. He was immediately defensive, says the driver was there and couldn't get a hold of me and has been wasting valueable time trying to make ME happy.  He talked over me and I wouldn't let me tell my side of the story.  After sternly asking "can I please talk" I shared my version which, I placed an order nearly 2 hours ago, my buzzer never rang but I got a text but still no one at the door, pizza taking over an hour to deliver, all sorts of issues.  He again was defensive, arrogant, and made zero effort to rectify the situation which very much frustrated me. He then said he didn't like MY attitude (one of a frustrated customer trying to get answers and a pizza) and he wasn't willing to help me and hung up on me! 

I then get a knock on my door a few minutes later (9pm) and the driver had called my building manager to let him in.  Turns out dispatch gave him the wrong apt # which explains the failed attempts. So kudos to the driver for not giving up and ensuring customer satisfaction but at that point I was too angry to eat. 

Had the manager employed some problem solving and customer service 101 skills before jumping to the conclusion that I was somehow at fault then this situation could have been avoided.  Ridiculously unprofessional behavior on his part.
author: Jennifer M.

description: If Peyton supports this place, so do I. Thanks Peyton!
author: Q W.

description: I am disappointed with this location. We ordered our pizza and had to call in two hours later since the pizza hadn't arrived. They told us it would come in 15 minutes (we were literally just two blocks down the street)....which means they hadn't even started the order (two hours in already!). An hour later they still hadn't arrived and their excuse was that it was the Super Bowl and they had other orders coming in to take care of first. Shouldn't the order we placed three hours ago take priority?? If you can't fulfill the order don't say you will. We finally got them to just cancel the order and refund us (refund pending). We decided to just order local instead from Village Pizzeria which only took them 15 minutes. We'll be contacting corporate as well to tell them to update their online ordering confirmation for this location to say "3+ hours or never" estimated delivery time.
author: Bun I.

description:
we ordered 2large pizzas,8 pc bbq wings,and 2ltrsoda for a total of 47$ we tipped 13$.. we are very very dissatisfied with our order i had half of slice and thats it!im not too picky but this pizza was beyond tasteless and cheese was not melted (undercooked) never again.. I rather have a mcdonalds next time lol 

at least the delivery man was nice thats the only reason for the 2stars..
author: Jess L.

description: Called 4 times and was put on hold each time, indefinitely. Then stopped picking up altogether. Just rude.
author: Harsh J.

description: It was sad that they change the price for the pizza. For an XL pizza, it was once before $23.99 in 2015 but now its $24.99 which was crazy since its been for half a year and raised the price since then. I would think that each year, they would raise the price for the pizza which sucks. All their pizzas are great. Wish they had some of their menu stayed like the bacon cheeseburger.
author: Nick F.

description: Not only is it the worst tasting Papa Johns in the city, but they are consistently double parked on Sutter causing traffic and safety issues. The manager there is a pretty good dude though.  +1 star for him.
author: Thomas C.

description:
The driver refused to get out of his car to deliver my last order a few weeks ago. He said there was no parking and was too dangerous (tons or parking just some crackheads on the sidewalk like always). I called the restaurant and they sent him back and he still refused to deliver the pizza. It's the big city Papa John sometimes their are harmless crackheads on the street. Toughen up pops (especially since your address is at Sutter and Hyde). So I called back again and the guy answering the phone said that the delivery guy was worried about his safety... Got news for ya. You are probably safer here the Tenderloin than you are in other parts of the city. 

Royal Pizza, Little Star, Pizza Hut, Patxi's, SF Pizza, North Beach Pizza, Roundtable, Sparky's, Village Pizzeria, Tony's Pizza Napoletana, Piccolo Pizza, can all deliver to my door...  but the new kid on the block from the Midwest can't hang. Sad. I guess I'll have to stick with DNA lounge who can send white women in the their early 20's to my door at 3am instead of Papa John's at 9-10pm. 

I'd love to know if this ever gets addressed. It was on Jan 2nd.
author: Benjamin V.

description: So I tried to give this place a second chance and it seemed they topped them self put a order in for a pizza and after waiting for a hour and a half I called to see where the food was they lied to me by saying they had just received the order 10 min prior to my call and that they were in the process of making the order meaning that it had not even gone in the oven after a hour and a half the pizza was just bearly  being made then 45 minutes later after talking with managers still no pizza they said the driver should be at my house shortly so they delivered my food 2hours and a half after placing my order so if u guys want delivery better call ur order at least a day in advanced if u want these people to get anything out to u on time but I bet even then they would still be late.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Don't order for delivery here. After ordering at 6 pm, still waiting at 8:41 pm and been put on hold about 3 times for almost 30 minutes. Anytime we connect to a real person, they just put us on hold again. So ridiculous.
author: Jessica K.

description: This particular location has some of the best customer service and best consistent quality of probably any Papa John's I have ordered from.  Best of the chain pizza's by far.  They are timely in their deliveries (traffic permitting) and honest about it if it may take longer than expected.  Good quality ingredients and tastes just as good cold.
author: Dan C.

description:
We ordered at 8pm and it's now 9:30pm and no pizza... They gave us a delivery estimate time of 30mins. We have guests over and planned to go to a movie after but this has us waiting, and very hungry.. 

We literally live a street down from them and should've just went there to order and eat there instead. We called and they put us on hold, and then said the driver is almost there and should only be 1 minute away. Funny, 15 mins later the driver calls saying he's now leaving and will be here in 5-10 mins. 


Never order delivery from this place. We only did because we got a flyer in the mail from them today. What a bust...
author: Monica H.

description: YUM!!! Really good pizza at really good prices! There is also "Buy one get one free" on Tuesdays which makes it even more easily affordable. The pizzas are huge so getting through 2 slices of a large pizza is difficult (probably the equivalent of 5 Aussie Pizza Hut slices). Their "The Works" and "Chicken and Bacon" pizzas were both delicious! Would definitely recommend but be prepared to wait up to an hour for pick-up/delivery (totally worth it) as they are usually quite busy - especially on Tuesdays!
author: Lisa P.

description: I had an issue with a delivery through a delivery service because the pizza had been tossed around a bit. Papa johns sent me another pizza without me even asking, free of charge. They also added in ice cream and a personal note of apology. Very good customer service.
author: Michelle D.

description: bad pizza, bland af, taste like chuckie cheese kids shit, cost $42 for mostly crust. never going again, can't believe this is a chain
author: Cara D.

description: Superb pizza spot, ordered online last week and received my order in thirty mins! The delivery guy was super friendly also, he even addressed me by name. Five star place, I will return.
author: Michaela A.

description: Fast delivery, good service and the pizza was good! I was worried that since it's Super Bowl Sunday it will take them hours to deliver my pizza BUT I was wrong. I ordered the pizza 20 minutes before they even open (not sure if they only do this for this special day) which was 10:00, I clicked 10:35 for delivery and my pizza did arrived around that time. They even gave me extra ranch and garlic dip!
author: Angela Z.

description: I have waited my whole life for this location to open in the heart of San Francisco and it finally opened a few months back. This Papa John's was supposed to open many years ago but the zoning and development restrictions in SF make it very difficult for new businesses to open. Now, anyone in SF can order Papa John's for delivery! It is truly a momentous year for everyone in SF! Papa John's also announced that over 50% of their sales in the US comes from digital and mobile channels, making it the first in the industry to surpass this unbelievable milestone. I use my Papa John's mobile app (available in the Apple and Android app store) to order from this location and it is truly the greatest ordering experience that I have ever experienced. There are plenty of deals via the app and you also get 1 free pizza with every 5 orders - how can you beat that? I encourage everyone to try the greatest pizza in the Bay Area because the pizza truly has better ingredients, better pizza, Papa John's.
author: Heisenberg W.

description: The pizza was ok, but forgot to send the soda that I ordered and the deliveryman was too impolite!
author: Jéssica R.

description: Food was decent. However, if you plan to order delivery, prepare to wait at least an hour and a half for your food. Their delivery was extremely slow, resulting in my one star rating.
author: Ken L.

description: Pizza is fine but please don't put up an "open late" sign when you close at 10-11 pm. Come on man! -1 star!
author: Brian H.

description: Think twice about ordering  from Sutter Street, some of their drivers have a real issue about actually bringing your pizza to your apartment.
author: john s.

description: I live next to it and for the third time in a row I have had bad service.. I understand that they get a lot of orders on the weekends but at least the pizza has to be cooked properly and if they say 10 piece popper it should have 10 pieces and I don't need the checkout guy making a snide comment that everybody has money when I bring up time of service.. Overall maybe it is a east coast thing where pizza and quality is appreciated definitely disappointed with this franchise???..is it a franchise thing??
author: Bill B.

description: I got Richard Javier as my delivery guy again. Cool guy, smart and out there hustling for the brand...I'm on the top floor of a three story walk up. I swear he sprinted up the stairs. Pappas John's should put this guy in management training.
author: Dave D.

description: Horrible service. The pizza got to our room cold and the lady was so rude they said it would take 30mins it was more like an 1 hour and 30min! She started banging on our hotel room very very hard I answer didn't say hi or anything.  She didn't even say thank you for the tip we gave her. I understand your miserable because your fat but it's not my fault your working at papa johns you don't have to treat others rudely.  Worst experience with papa johns ever!! Never ordering at this place ever again! They need better customer service.
author: Raquel H.

description: Horrible horrible service took more then nothing hour for my pizza to get here driver kept calling cause he couldn't fid my apartment when there is only 10 apartments in my floor . Pizza got here freezing cold and wet since it's raining outside . First timer for papa johns and never again will I order from here if I could I'd give it 0 stars . Only giving it two because manager understood and it was an alright pizza don't recommend this place at all
author: Lizz C.

description: The pizza is fine, and the price is excellent. I've become far too fond of the fresh baked chocolate chip cookie "pizza", it's gooey and wonderful.
author: andrew f.

description: Far above my expectations. If you compare to other chains (Domino's, Pizza Hut, Round Table) it is far superior. Placed order at 7:30pm and it arrived at 8:15pm.
author: Walter W.

description: This place has the BEST specials and their staff is incredibly friendly. I've ordered and picked up pizza here multiple times, and anytime Jasmine is working she is so sweet and provides customer service you would expect at a 5 star restaurant. She is truly a gem. I order a vegan veggie pizza (just say no cheese) and it's SO SO yummy!!
author: gabrielle d.

description: Ordered ahead at 4PM for 6:30 PM on a Monday. It's 7 and pizza isn't here. Was told it will be here in "5-10 mins." Will be using a different location next time.
author: Shannon S.

description: i called in the morning for a 6pm delivery and at 6pm they delivered a great chicken and garlic pizza. not sure what made this the best pizza I have had in years it\had roasted garlic and enough chicken. not overly heavy or too rich just perfect, I ordered hand tossed crust.and will order again. fresh tasting and great service.
author: Ann H.

description: WOW Happy Thanksgiving! I called this location to order a pizza and when the pizza guy answered the phone with "we're closed right now" I was like, wtf what kind of customer service is this?  I truly don't care that you had to work on Thanksgiving but the fact is that you in the CUSTOMER SERVICE INDUSTRY and as we all know, your ONLY priority is GOOD customer service.  Note to the OWNER, whoever worked thanksgiving night at 8:15pm needs to be taught how to work for you.  Just know that this employee is not making a good name for your Papa Johns location.  Just for you information the proper response would have been, "Hello, thank you for calling Papa John's, but our location is currently closed."
author: Megan M.

description: Went to the new location on Sutter, they screwed up my order, but Dean, the manager, made up for it by giving us the incorrect pizza, the correct pizza and a cookie pizza for our troubles. Would recommend this location and manager.
author: Dan L.
